title: Jose Mourinho showing us again at Manchester United why he's the Special One, says Rio Ferdinand
text:
Sport Jose Mourinho showing us again at Manchester United why he's the Special One, says Rio Ferdinand The Old Trafford giants are now unbeaten in 17 games following a slow start as they tried to shake off their hangover from Louis van Gaal's reign Share Ferdinand fancies former club Man United to be fighting for the title in a year's time (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Rio Ferdinand believes Jose Mourinho can turn Manchester United into champions next season - but warned they face their biggest ever transfer window next summer. 
Former United defender Ferdinand admits he always feared it would take boss Mourinho a whole year to transform the Old Trafford giants after predecessor Louis van Gaal’s reign ended in disappointment. 
But Ferdinand says the club will have to spend big in the summer and get the biggest names to challenge for the title itself rather than just chase a place in the top four as they are doing now. 
The England star turned TV pundit said: “The next window is a big one for United in terms of getting players out and getting some in who will invigorate this squad and be able to carry out his methods. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Legend Fergie says Mourinho has United on right track: "The team is mirroring its manager" 
“I like what Mourinho has done. He has shown again he is a top manager. We have seen with Pep [Guardiola, in his debut season across town at City] how difficult it is to get it right. Jose is doing that really well. 
"He would want to be further up the table but you can see the characteristics of United of old. 
“I always thought at the beginning Jose had a really tough job — because of the squad. Not just because of the profile of the players but because of the mentality that was ingrained in those footballers. 
“The confidence levels were very low, the style of football they were taught play was alien to Manchester United in terms of the characteristics and history of the club. It is a big job, without even thinking what players he had there in terms of changing the whole psyche." 
United currently sit sixth — four points adrift of arch-rivals Liverpool, who occupy the final Champions League place. Atletico Madrid's Antoine Griezmann is strongly linked with a summer move to United (Photo: Getty) Read More 
“I think they are where I expected them to be – maybe I thought they would be in the top four but they are not far from where I thought," said Ferdinand. 
"I thought the job was that big. 
“A lot will determine on the players they bought in, like [Paul] Pogba, Zlatan [Ibrahimovic] who has been phenomenal and [Henrikh] Mkhitaryan, who is starting to show what he can do. 
“They are three players who can take the club forward but there is still work to be done. United need to finish in the top four this season, but it will be difficult. It is tight there, They are fighting with Liverpool and City. 
“I hope they finish in the top four. But it is so difficult. United have not lost in 17 games but have drawn a lot. I would rather lose a few and get wins, in terms of points. That has been the frustrating thing. New boys Ibrahimovic and Pogba have helped United back into the top-four fight (Photo: AFP/Getty) Read More 
“They have played well in that period but they have dropped points through silly areas. If they want to finish in the top four they have to defend diligently and take their chances. 
"It is not rocket science.” 
Ferdinand has also claimed former team-mate Wayne Rooney does not get the appreciation he deserves in his own country, even after becoming breaking Sir Bobby Charlton's records to become all-time top scorer for England and now United. 
“I think he’s appreciated more on the continent than he is in this country. That’s a shame because a lot of foreign teams would loved to have taken him many times,” said Ferdinand. 
“They’d see he wasn’t just an out-and-out striker, he wasn’t just a ten, he was a combination of both. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
